abstract: Why Bank of America shouldn’t count on putting its foreclosure problems behind it so quickly.
snippet: Why Bank of America shouldn’t count on putting its foreclosure problems behind it so quickly.
lead_paragraph: Earlier this week, Bank of America, the nation’s largest consumer bank, reported its third-quarter earnings. It was a very good quarter; putting aside an accounting charge  a very large, $10.4 billion accounting charge, admittedly  the bank reported $3.1 billion in profits. It was the third consecutive quarter that Bank of America had earned more than $3 billion.

headline.main: Big Problem for Banks: Due Process
headline.print_headline: Big Problem For Banks: Due Process
